summary: Expand the LE GOURMAND mobile app Products catalog beyond the initial 3 items by adding 20 additional gourmet products to the Products screen, each with its own distinct placeholder image, while keeping the existing dark luxury design and client-side cart behavior.
architectural_notes: No payment/checkout/subscription logic (e.g., Stripe) should be implemented; page is informational only.
Buttons are simple external redirects (same tab) to Tiendup URLs per plan; no in-app payment/subscription flow is added.
Update color palette: elegant green primary accents; black background; white text; keep existing layout/design otherwise unchanged.
Only update plan text: add a short description under each plan name; do not change layout/design or add new sections/features.
Project scope is now a mobile app (not just a single informational web page).
Authentication must use Firebase (sign up + login).
App should include Home, Memberships, Profile, and Terms & Conditions screens.
Use a dark luxury visual style: black as main color with elegant accent colors.
Products require displaying product images in the UI (provide assets/placeholders as needed).
Cart functionality should remain client-side only unless backend persistence is explicitly requested later (no checkout/payment flow implied).
known_issues: Clicking "Select plan" does not open a new window/tab as expected.
imageRequirements:

existing_features.title: Create a standalone Membership Plans page for the LE GOURMAND brand that displays three membership plan cards side by side: Simple, Normal, and Premium.
For each plan card, include: plan name, a short description, a price text (display-only), and a button labeled exactly “Suscribirse”.
Visually mark the Normal plan as “Popular” (e.g., with a badge/chip) while keeping it consistent with the luxury minimalist theme.
Apply a luxury, minimalist, dark visual theme consistent with the LE GOURMAND brand across the Membership Plans page (typography, spacing, borders, hover states).
Ensure the page is informational only: do not add Stripe, checkout, payment processing, subscription creation, or any backend logic related to payments/subscriptions.

Update the Membership Plans page theme so the overall background is black, text is white, and the primary/accent color is an elegant green, while keeping the existing layout and design elements unchanged (cards, spacing, typography, badge, etc.).
Change the “Suscribirse” buttons so that each plan redirects in the same browser tab to the specified external URL (Simple/Normal/Premium).
Remove any Stripe, checkout, or payment-related logic if present, and ensure the Membership Plans page remains informational-only with no payment system added.

Update the existing Membership Plans page to keep the current layout and design and only change the short description text under each plan name to the exact English copy provided:
- Simple: "Access to curated content and basic member benefits."
- Normal: "Everything in Simple, plus exclusive offers and priority access."
- Premium: "Full access to all benefits, VIP experiences, and premium content."

Do not add, remove, or restructure any UI sections/components; only update the description text values currently used for each plan (e.g., in the plans data in frontend/src/pages/MembershipPlansPage.tsx).

Replace the single-page app (currently rendering only `MembershipPlansPage`) with an app shell that supports navigating between these screens: Home, Memberships, Profile, and Terms & Conditions, optimized for mobile-sized viewports.

Implement user authentication for the app using Internet Identity (supported on this platform) and provide a login/logout experience that covers the user's requested sign up/login flow as closely as possible (single 'Sign in' flow plus 'Sign out').
Create a Home screen with premium branding copy and layout for a private gourmet membership club, using English for all user-facing text.

Create a Memberships screen that displays exactly three membership plans with the following names and prices: Simple $50, Normal $200, Premium $350, presented in a dark luxury style consistent with the app theme.

Add the ability for an authenticated user to select a membership plan in the Memberships screen, persist that selection to the backend keyed by the user's principal, and reflect the selected membership type in the Profile screen.

Implement a Profile screen that displays (1) the current user's name and (2) their membership type. If no explicit name is set, display a reasonable default derived from the authenticated identity (e.g., principal text).
Implement a Terms & Conditions screen with static English content and make it reachable via navigation.
Apply a dark, luxury design style across all new screens using black as the main color and elegant accent colors, consistent with the existing LE GOURMAND theme tokens.
Add two new app routes/screens: a Products screen and a Cart screen, and make both reachable via the existing app shell navigation.

Implement a Products screen that renders a simple catalog of exactly three gourmet products, each showing: product image, name, description, price, and an “Add to Cart” button (button label must be exactly “Add to Cart”).
Implement a Cart screen that allows users to view products added to the cart, remove items, and see a total price across all cart items.
Add shared client-side cart state so that items added on the Products screen appear on the Cart screen without requiring a backend call.

Add and use three static product images as generated assets stored under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`, and render them in the Products screen (and optionally in the Cart screen) via standard static asset paths.
Add the uploaded logo image ("logo big.png") as a static frontend asset and display it in the main app header (AppShell) alongside the brand name, keeping the existing dark luxury styling.

Fix the "Select Plan" button behavior on the Memberships screen so that clicking it opens the plan destination in a new browser tab/window; ensure the new tab/window navigation works reliably (no-op bug), while keeping the existing membership selection persistence behavior intact.

Expand the static products catalog in `frontend/src/data/products.ts` by adding all additional gourmet products provided by the user (in addition to the existing 3 products), so they appear in the existing Products screen without any UI restructuring.

Add distinct placeholder images for each newly added product as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`, and reference them from the corresponding `imageSrc` fields in `frontend/src/data/products.ts`.

Keep existing cart behavior intact so that any of the newly added products can be added to the cart from the Products screen and viewed/totaled in the Cart screen using the existing shared client-side cart state.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create LE GOURMAND Membership Plans page with three side-by-side cards (Simple, Normal marked 'Popular', Premium) including name, short description, visual price text, and 'Suscribirse' button; informational only with no payment/subscription logic; luxury minimalist dark theme.

Update Membership Plans page styling to elegant green accents with black background and white text, remove any Stripe/checkout/payment logic if present, and make “Suscribirse” buttons redirect in the same tab to the provided external URLs for each plan (no payment system added).

Add short descriptions under each plan name on the existing Membership Plans page (Simple/Normal/Premium) using the provided exact copy; keep layout/design unchanged and do not add any new sections/features.
Create a mobile app for LE GOURMAND with a dark, luxury design style (black main color with elegant accents) and premium branding for a private gourmet membership club.
Implement user authentication (sign up and login) using Firebase for the LE GOURMAND mobile app.

Add core app screens: Home screen (premium branding), Memberships screen with three plans and prices (Simple $50, Normal $200, Premium $350), Profile screen showing user name and membership type, and a Terms & Conditions screen.

Extend the Motoko backend (`backend/main.mo`) to support storing and retrieving a user profile record keyed by caller principal, including at minimum: membershipType (Simple|Normal|Premium|None) and an optional displayName.
Add a Products screen featuring a simple catalog of exactly three gourmet products; each product shows an image, name, description, price, and an “Add to Cart” button.
Add a Cart screen where users can view products added to cart, remove items, and see a total price.
Add the user's logo to the app UI (brand/header) while keeping the existing dark luxury design style.
Update the Membership plan selection behavior so clicking "Select plan" opens the intended destination in a new window/tab.

Expand the Products screen catalog by adding 20 additional gourmet products (as provided by the user) and ensure each new product has a distinct placeholder image so all items render properly in the UI.
